items.title: My first stool - 2010
items.text:
The first stool I made during my education at Nyckelviksskolan – Wood.

The stool is made in pine wood and painted with a thin coat of white and turquoise.

The inspiration for the stool comes from earthquakes - how the plate tectonics move to make horrible nature catastrophes for us humans.

items.title: Alternative Time – 2011
items.text: A clock that shows time with an LED light that travels around. It will never tell you the exact time. Stress is a big problem in today’s society and I think one of the reasons is that everyone expects everything go much quicker than it actually does, so if we have a clock that shows us only full and half hours maybe people would slow down and enjoy life.

items.title: Fang necklace – 2012
items.text: Ceramic fang necklaces with one fang in a holographic coating.

items.title: Kitchen poster - 2014
items.text:
When moving from Sweden to UK I had big troubles converting all the measurements in the kitchen, so I created a quick and easy way to visually see conversions instead of always looking it up on the internet.

The poster comes in 3 colors, Dark green, black and red in the size A2.

items.title: Booze Octopus – 2014
items.text: A quick model of an octopus dressed up as a ghost saying “Boooozzze”.

items.title: Wooden spoons – 2014
items.text: Carved spoons for an assignment at Brighton university.
